intro: Calceolaria yolandae, commonly known as the Yolanda's slipper orchid, is a striking member of the Calceolaria genus native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its unique, slipper-shaped flowers that range in color from deep red to purple, often with intricate patterns. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions with well-drained soil. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that form a basal rosette, supporting the showy inflorescence. Due to its limited habitat and specific ecological requirements, Calceolaria yolandae is considered a rare and specialized species.
